content:
EventProvider Class

Definition

Use this class to write events.

In this Article

public class EventProvider : IDisposable
Inheritance
System.Object
EventProvider

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

To consume events written using the WriteEvent and WriteTransferEvent methods, the events must be defined in a manifest; events written using the WriteMessageEvent method do not require a manifest.

Events can contain the following managed data types:

  • bool

  • Boolean

  • byte

  • char

  • decimal

  • double

  • float

  • Guid

  • int

  • IntPtr

  • long

  • sbyte

  • short

  • string

  • uint

  • UInt64

    If an event in your manifest uses the Boolean in-type, you cannot write the data element using a Boolean data type in your managed code. The Boolean in-type in your manifest expects a 4-byte value, and a Boolean data type in managed code is 1-byte. Instead, you must use an int data type to write the value. If you want to log a Boolean value, use the UInt8 in-type in your manifest.

Constructors

EventProvider(Guid)

Initializes a new instance of the EventProvider class.

public EventProvider (Guid providerGuid);
providerGuid
Guid

Guid that uniquely identifies the provider.

Exceptions
InsufficientMemoryException

There is not enough memory to complete the operation.

PlatformNotSupportedException

The classes in the System.Diagnostics.Eventing namespace work only on Windows Vista.

ArgumentException

The providerGuid parameter cannot be null.

Win32Exception

An error returned by the ETW subsystem.

Remarks

Registers the provider. To remove the registration when finished, call the Close method.

Methods

Close()

Removes the provider's registration from the ETW subsystem and releases all unmanaged resources.

public virtual void Close ();
Exceptions
Win32Exception

An error returned by the ETW subsystem.

Remarks

You should call this method when finished instead of waiting for the system to dispose of the resources.

CreateActivityId()

Creates a unique activity identifier for the provider.

public static Guid CreateActivityId ();
Returns
Guid

A unique Guid that you use when calling the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.SetActivityId* method to set the activity identifier for the provider.

Remarks

This is a static method.

Dispose()

Releases the resources used by this EventProvider object.

public void Dispose ();

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the resources used by this EventProvider object.

protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

This parameter is ignored by this method since there are no unmanaged resources.

Finalize()

Frees resources and performs internal cleanup before the instance is reclaimed by garbage collection.

~EventProvider ();

GetLastWriteEventError()

Gets the last error associated with an event write failure.

public static System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEventErrorCode GetLastWriteEventError ();
Returns

Use the value to determine the cause of an event write failure.

Remarks

The WriteEvent, WriteMessageEvent, and WriteTransferEvent methods set this value if they fail to write the event.

This is a static method.

IsEnabled()

Determines whether any session enabled the provider, regardless of the level and keyword values used to enable the provider.

public bool IsEnabled ();
Returns
Boolean

Is true if the provider is enabled to any session; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Typically, a provider does not call this method to determine whether the provider has been enabled by a session; the provider simply writes the event, and ETW determines whether the event is logged to the session. A provider may want to call this function if the provider needs to perform extra work to generate the event. In this case, calling this function first may save resources and time.

IsEnabled(Byte,Int64)

Determines whether any session is requesting the specified event from the provider.

public bool IsEnabled (byte level, long keywords);
level
Byte

Level of detail included in the event.

keywords
Int64

Bit mask that specifies the event category. This mask should be the same keyword mask that is defined in the manifest for the event.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if any session is requesting the specified event; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Typically, a provider does not call this method to determine whether a session requested the specified event; the provider simply writes the event, and ETW determines whether the event is logged to a session. A provider may want to call this function if the provider needs to perform extra work to generate the event. In this case, calling this function first to determine if a session requested the event or not, may save resources and time.

SetActivityId(Guid)

Sets the current activity identifier used by the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent* methods.

public static void SetActivityId (ref Guid id);
id
Guid

A unique activity identifier that the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.CreateActivityId* method returns.

Remarks

The identifier is stored in the thread context.

Note that in version 3.5 of the .NET framework, you had to set the id parameter of this method and the ActivityId property value to the same identifier value. However, in version 4.0 of the framework, the SetActivityId method automatically sets the correlation activity identifier for you.

This is a static method.

WriteEvent(EventDescriptor,Object[])

Writes an event. The event data is specified as an array of objects.

public bool WriteEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, object[] eventPayload);
eventDescriptor
EventDescriptor

An instance of EventDescriptor that identifies the event to write.

eventPayload
Object[]

An array of objects that contain the event data to write. The object must be in the order specified in the manifest. The array is limited to 32 objects, of which only eight may be strings. The maximum data size for the event is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.

This parameter can be null.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if the event is written; otherwise, false. If false, call the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError* method to determine the cause of the failure.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The eventPayload parameter contains too many objects or strings.

Remarks

If you call the SetActivityId method to specify an activity identifier for the event, this method retrieves the identifier from the thread context and includes it with the event.

If the object type is not supported, the method writes the value of the object's ToString method in the payload. For a list of supported object types, see the Remarks for the EventProvider class.

WriteEvent(EventDescriptor,String)

Writes an event. The event data is specified as a string.

public bool WriteEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, string data);
eventDescriptor
EventDescriptor

An instance of EventDescriptor that identifies the event to write.

data
String

The string to write as the event data.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if the event is written; otherwise, false. If false, call the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError* method to determine the cause of the failure.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

If data is null.

Remarks

If you call the SetActivityId method to specify an activity identifier for the event, this method retrieves the identifier from the thread context and includes it with the event.

The maximum string length is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.

WriteEvent(EventDescriptor,Int32,IntPtr)

Writes an event. The event data is specified as a block of memory.

protected bool WriteEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, int dataCount, IntPtr data);
eventDescriptor
EventDescriptor

An instance of EventDescriptor that identifies the event to write.

dataCount
Int32

Size of the event data to which the data parameter points. The maximum event data size is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.

data
IntPtr

Pointer to the event data to write.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if the event is written; otherwise, false. If false, call the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError* method to determine the cause of the failure.

Remarks

If you call the SetActivityId method to specify an activity identifier for the event, this method retrieves the identifier from the thread context and includes it with the event.

WriteMessageEvent(String)

Writes an event that contains a string as its data.

public bool WriteMessageEvent (string eventMessage);
eventMessage
String

String to write as the event data.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if the event is written; otherwise, false. If false, call the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError* method to determine the cause of the failure.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

If eventMessage is null.

Remarks

The maximum string length is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.

WriteMessageEvent(String,Byte,Int64)

Writes an event that contains a string as its data if the level and keyword value match the events requested by the session.

public bool WriteMessageEvent (string eventMessage, byte eventLevel, long eventKeywords);
eventMessage
String

String to write as the event data.

eventLevel
Byte

Level of detail included in the event. If the provider uses a manifest to define the event, set this value to the same level defined in the manifest.

eventKeywords
Int64

Bit mask that specifies the event category. If the provider uses a manifest to define the event, set this value to the same keyword mask defined in the manifest.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if the event is written; otherwise, false. If false, call the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError* method to determine the cause of the failure.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

If eventMessage is null.

Remarks

The maximum string length is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.

WriteTransferEvent(EventDescriptor,Guid,Object[])

Links events together when tracing events in an end-to-end scenario. The event data is specified as an array of objects.

public bool WriteTransferEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, Guid relatedActivityId, object[] eventPayload);
eventDescriptor
EventDescriptor

An instance of EventDescriptor that identifies the event to write.

relatedActivityId
Guid

Activity identifier from the previous component. Use this parameter to link your component's events to the previous component's events.

eventPayload
Object[]

An array of objects that contain the event data to write. The data must be in the order specified in the manifest. The array is limited to 32 objects, of which only eight may be strings. The maximum data size for the event is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if the event is written; otherwise, false. If false, call the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError* method to determine the cause of the failure.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

If eventPayload contains too many objects or strings.

Remarks

The method uses the activity ID set in the thread context to identify this component. To set the activity ID, call the SetActivityId method.

If you use the Trace class, you do not use the SetActivityId method to specify the activity ID. Instead, access the CorrelationManager property to get the CorrelationManager object. Then, set the ActivityId property to the activity ID. You must also set the relatedActivityId to a ActivityId value.

WriteTransferEvent(EventDescriptor,Guid,Int32,IntPtr)

Links events together when tracing events in an end-to-end scenario. The event data is specified as a block of memory.

protected bool WriteTransferEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, Guid relatedActivityId, int dataCount, IntPtr data);
eventDescriptor
EventDescriptor

An instance of EventDescriptor that identifies the event to write.

relatedActivityId
Guid

Activity identifier from the previous component. Use this parameter to link your component's events to the previous component's events.

dataCount
Int32

Size of the event data to which the data parameter points. The maximum event data size is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.

data
IntPtr

Pointer to the event data to write.

Returns
Boolean

Is true if the event is written; otherwise, false. If false, call the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError* method to determine the cause of the failure.

Remarks

The method uses the activity ID set in the thread context to identify this component. To set the activity ID, call the SetActivityId method.
